thread.title: ‘Grimm’ episode pushed to Saturday by Trail Blazers game on KGW
thread.title_full: ‘Grimm’ episode pushed to Saturday by Trail Blazers game on KGW

author: Kristi Turnquist | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: ‘Grimm’ episode pushed to Saturday by Trail Blazers game on KGW
text:
'Grimm' episode pushed to Saturday by Trail Blazers game on KGW Grimm - Season 6 comments 
Attention, "Grimm" fans in Portland -- once again this Friday, the NBC show is bumped out of its usual time slot by a Portland Trail Blazers game, which will be broadcast on KGW/8 starting at 7 p.m. 
The Blazers will be playing the Dallas Mavericks at the Moda Center. We don't know who'll win the game, but we do know this means "Grimm" fans will again have to be patient. 
Last time the Blazers bumped "Grimm" out of the Friday berth, the show aired in the wee, small hours of Saturday morning. So when will we find out what happens in the fifth episode of the sixth and final "Grimm" season? 
Relax. This week's "Grimm" episode airs at the reasonable hour of 8 p.m. Saturday, Feb. 4. The episode's title is "The Seven Year Itch," but it doesn't sound like it has anything to do with the movie that starred Marilyn Monroe. 
Nope, there's another new case involving a murder in a Portland park. While Nick (David Giuntoli), Hank (Russell Hornsby) and Wu (Reggie Lee) are investigating, Captain Renard (Sasha Roiz) is still having ghostly visions. 
As usual, I'll be sharing my thoughts about the episode right here at Oregonlive, on Saturday night after the episode airs. Come on back and weigh in with what you think after watching. 
Oh, and "Emerald City" fans, this week's episode will also be bumped on Friday by the Blazers game. The new "Emerald City" episode will instead air at 9 p.m. Saturday, right after "Grimm." 
-- Kristi Turnquist
